comments:
RAC README doc doesn't explain that config.jar is needed to run SetConfig.sh,
nor how to build it.
To generate config.jar, I went to
platform/org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller/src-config

and ran:
javac org/eclipse/tptp/platform/agentcontroller/config/*.java
jar -cvf config.jar org/eclipse/tptp/platform/agentcontroller/config/*.class


which seemed to generate the proper config.jar, but when running SetConfig.sh,
the program fails with the followin error:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.util.StringTokenizer.<init>(StringTokenizer.java:146)
        at java.util.StringTokenizer.<init>(StringTokenizer.java:162)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.config.TestJvm.isMinimumVersion(TestJvm.java:53)
        at
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller.config.SetConfig.main(SetConfig.java:33)


the config.jar file from the .zip archive from the download area works just fine.

Am I doing something wrong?
Could this the build process to get config.sh be documented? 

FWIW:
java version "1.4.2_08"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.2_08-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.2_08-b03, mixed mode)


TIA,

Guillaume J. POIRIER
Samson, please provide the information that's needed to update the READMe.

I propose, as 9 bis):
Import in Eclipse workbench the Java project located at
dev.eclipse.org\home\tptp\platform\org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller/
to build the source in the sub-directory src-config/
Then export that plugin as a JAR file named config.jar that you will copy to
<working>/<build ID>/collection/packaging/lib
That JAR will be used by the SetConfig.sh script that you will run later on.

...

As a side note, I'd be more that happy if it was possible to build config.jar on
command line only, but that's probably less important.

(In reply to comment #2)
> I propose, as 9 bis):
> Import in Eclipse workbench the Java project located at
> dev.eclipse.org\home\tptp\platform\org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller/
> to build the source in the sub-directory src-config/
> Then export that plugin as a JAR file named config.jar that you will copy to
> <working>/<build ID>/collection/packaging/lib
> That JAR will be used by the SetConfig.sh script that you will run later on.

That text is not really accurate... I'd prefer the following:

9 bis):
 Import in Eclipse workbench the Java project located at
dev.eclipse.org\home\tptp\platform\org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller/
You will need to have either the SDK of TPTP or the projects that
org.eclipse.tptp.platform.agentcontroller depends on so that the compilation can
go though.
 Then export that plugin as a "Deployable pluggins and fragments", and save it
in a directory.
In that directory, you will find a file named config.jar that you need to copy
to <working>/<build ID>/collection/packaging/lib
 That JAR will be used by the SetConfig.sh script that you will run later on to
configure the RAC.
